sentences.sentence: Volodymyr Zelenskyy has delivered a confident address to the Ukrainian people on the nation's VOLODYMYR ZELENSKYY HAS DELIVERED A CONFIDENT ADDRESS TO THE UKRAINIAN PEOPLE ON THE NATION'S DAY OF THE DEFENDERS, WHICH HONORS THE COUNTRY'S ARMED FORCES.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At a cemetery outside Kharkiv, families mark the National Day by honoring those who have died in the war. Promises from the United States and Germany to reinforce the country's defenses have been welcomed, but the president of Belarus, Alexander Lukashenko, has claimed that the West and Ukraine are threatening Belarus' territory and has appealed to Moscow for help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian troops have reinforced their presence on the Belarusian border in response to the expected arrival of Russian forces on the other side.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile in the occupied east the Red Cross has said it has not been able to obtain access to the Olenovika prisoners of war camp as demanded by the Ukrainian presidency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At least 28 miners have been killed and many more remain trapped underground following an explosion in a coal mine in Turkey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Emergency services have been working throughout the night to try to reach those still missing in the mine in Amasra, near the Black Sea coast.

sentences.sentence: The explosion happened yesterday evening and is believed to have been caused by a build-up of gases in mine shafts 300 metres below ground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has announced that he is to personally oversee the rescue operation, saying that the goal was that no more lives should be lost.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Of the injured, many are reported to be in a critical condition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Turkey has suffered many industrial accidents in recent years. 301 people were killed following a fire in a coal mine in Soma in 2014.

sentences.sentence: Turmoil within Britain's government has deepened with the sacking of Kwasi Kwarteng as Chancellor of the Exchequer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Liz Truss, a close friend of Kwarteng, said she was replacing him to stabilise the economy after his planned controversial tax cuts had spooked the financial markets. Despite having devised those reforms with Kuarteng, Truss said he had to go.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The appointment of Jeremy Hunt is seen as an attempt to reassure the markets and voters that the government is turning away from radical monetarist policies that had been so unpopular with both.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Two brothers in Malta have been sentenced in the murder of an anti-corruption journalist that shocked the small European nation. Alfred and George DiGiorgio pled guilty on Friday to the car bomb murder, hours after initially entering not guilty pleas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The pair now face 40 years in prison for Daphne Caruana Galizia's death five years ago.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Caruana Galizia was killed on October 16, 2017, when the bomb was planted in her car.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The explosion was large enough to cause the car to fly over a wall and into a field. She was just 53 years old. Before her death she investigated the Panama Papers leak and discovered corruption in the highest levels of the Maltese government. The attack shocked the country which serves as a major financial haven in the Mediterranean and led to the resignation of then Prime Minister Joseph Muscat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Activists in Iran have called for fresh protest as mass anti-government demonstrations enter their fifth week despite a brutal crackdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At least 108 people have died in the unrest following the death of 22-year-old Masha Amini, according to Amnesty International.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Another 93 people were killed in separate clashes in Zahedan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: At least 23 minors are among the dead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The European Union's foreign policy chief, Joseph Borrell, called for an end to the violent repression of protesters when speaking to his Iranian counterpart on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The bloc is also considering issuing sanctions against Tehran, a move that would follow the United States, United Kingdom and Canada.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A pair of climate activists have thrown soup on one of the world's most recognizable paintings, Vincent van Gogh's sunflowers, before gluing themselves to the wall.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: They are part of a group called Just Stop Oil, which is calling for an end to new oil and gas projects in the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: What is worth more, art or life?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Is it worth more than food? Worth more than justice? Are you more concerned about the protection of a painting or the protection of our planet and people?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The cost of living crisis is part of the cost of oil crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Fuel is unaffordable to millions of cold, hungry families.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They can't even afford to heat a tin of soup.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The painting which hangs behind glass was unharmed by the attack. The demonstrators have been arrested on suspicion of criminal damage and aggravated trespass. The action is just the latest climate protest in the UK as the government opens new licensing applications for North Sea oil and gas exploration.
